page.title: 06MADLEY EARTH STATION Pt2
page.content: Madley was the second earth station to be built, it was needed to provide diversity and to meet the rapid growth in international calls. It took 3 years before a suitable site was found. Madley was an 'electrically quiet' area, free from other radio interference and the ground was stable enough to carry aerials and buildings and large enough to allow future growth. The Station also had to be as close to London as possible because most international calls originate or pass through the capital. Areas served are the Middle East, Africa, the Far East, Australasia, the Indian sub-continent, Europe and North America.
